maml:description.maml:para: Upload new SPP Baseline to appliance firmware repository.
This Cmdlet provides the ability to upload a new SPP Baseline into the appliance. It will return after the upload has completed but before the SPP file has been imported into the firmware repository.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
Specify to return Asynchronous task after file upload has completed.

Aliases [-sppFile]
he full path and file name of the SPP file or FileSystemInfo object from Get-ChildItem. The function returns an error if the file path cannot be validated.
The File object FullName.
The File object(s) from Get-ChildItem (GCI).
The progress of uploading the file to the appliance, and in-progress or completion result.

dev:remarks.dev:para: Upload SPP ISO to the default connected appliance.
"Get the baselines from the specified directory, pass them as System.IO.FileSystemInfo va the pipeline, and upload to the default connected appliance.

maml:description.maml:para: Import an enclosure.

This Cmdlet will import an enclosure for HPE OneView management. The Onboard Administrator needs to have at least an IP Address for each OA module, and a valid Administrator account. An Enclosure Group must also be created.
Add-HPOVEnclosure will attempt a connection to the XML Reply interface to examine if an existing VC Domain is present. If so, you are prompted if you wish to continue and force import the enclosure. FORCE IMPORT OF AN ENCLOSURE WILL DELETE ANY EXISTING VC DOMAIN CONFIGURATION, AND NOT PERFORM ANY VC DOMAIN CONFIGURATION MIGRATION. PLEASE BACKUP YOUR VC DOMAIN IF YOU WISH TO RESTORE TO ITS ORIGINAL CONFIGURATION.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default

Aliases [-fwIso, -fwBaselineIsoFilename]
Baseline File Name, Name, URI or Object.
Examples:
$FileName = "bp-hp-service-pack-for-proliant-oneview-2014-11-30-05.iso" $Name = "HP Service Pack For ProLiant OneView 2014 11 13"

When attempting to add a Server to the appliance, the appliance will validate the target Server is not already claimed. If it is, this parameter is used when the server has been claimed by another appliance to bypass the confirmation prompt, and force add the server resource.

Aliases [-eg, -enclGroupName]
Enclosure Group Name to associate with the enclosure to import.

Aliases [-forceFw, -forceInstall]
Force the installation of the provided Firmware Baseline.

Aliases [-oa]
IP Address, Hostname or FQDN of the Primary C7000 Onboard Administrator (OA).

Aliases [-license, -l]
Specifies whether the intent is to apply either OneView or OneView w/o iLO licenses to the servers in the enclosure being imported.
Accepted values are
* OneView * OneViewNoiLO

Add the specified enclosure for monitor only management. You can view hardware for inventory and status information only. Omitting this parameter, you can apply configurations, deploy server profiles, monitor operation status, collect statistics, and alert users to specific conditions.

Aliases [-p, -pw]
Administrator Account password of the OA specified.

Aliases [-u, -user]
Administrator account of the target OA. Can be either an OA Local Administrator or Active Directory (AD) account if the OA is configured for AD authentication.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
Async task Resource object for monitoring the enclosure import process.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Add-HPOVEnclosure -oa "192.168.1.1" -enclGroupName EG1 -user admin -pass hpinvent -license OneView

dev:remarks.dev:para: Add a new enclosure to the appliance, using the EG1 Enclosure Group.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Add-HPOVEnclosure -oa "192.168.1.1" -enclGroupName EG1 -user admin -pass hpinvent -license OneView -confirm:$false Add a new enclosure to the appliance, using the EG1 Enclosure Group, and force add the target enclosure.

dev:remarks.dev:para: THIS IS A DISTRUCTIVE PROCESS IF AN EXISTING VC DOMAIN EXISTS.

maml:description.maml:para: Add a supported SAN Manager

Add a new SAN Manager to the appliance. SAN Managers are hardware or software systems that manage SANs. The SAN Managers resource enables you to bring SAN management systems and the SANs they manage under management of the appliance. You can associate the managed SANs to Fibre Channel networks on the appliance when creating a (New-HPOVNetwork) or updating an existing (Set-HPOVNetwork) Fibre Channel Network Resource. This enables the appliance to automate zoning to make the SANs visible to server profiles. Zoning defines connections between Fibre Channel endpoints. Zones are a group of endpoints that can communicate with each other. Open SANs allow communication between all endpoints.
Supported SAN Managers are:
* Brocade SAN Network Advisor * HPE Networking 5900CP (FC or FCoE) * HPE Networking 5900AF (FC-only) * Cisco Nexus (FC or FCoE) * Cisco MDS (FC-only)
Please see the HPE OneView Support Matrix for supported versions.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
Return the Asynchronous task immediately.
FQDN or IP Address of the SAN Manager
Password used to authenticate and manage the SAN Manager. This is only applicable for BNA SAN Manager.
TCP Port of the SAN Manager. The default port for Brocade Network Advisor is '5989'. The default port for HPN 5900CP is '161'.

The SNMPv3 Authentication Level. Allowed values are:
* None - No Security is required, only the SNMPv3 UserName is provided. * AuthOnly - SNMPv3 Authentication Encryption Security Level only. Must also provide -SnmpAuthProtocol and -SnmpAuthPassword parameters. * AuthAndPriv - SNMPv3 Authentication Encryption Security and Privacy Levels. Must also provide -SnmpAuthProtocol, -SnmpAuthPassword, -SnmpPrivProtocol and -SnmpPrivPassword parameters.
SNMPv3 UserName Password.

SNMPv3 Password Encryption Protocol. Allowed values are:
* SHA * MD5
SNMPv3 Privacy Encryption Password.

SNMPv3 Privacy Protocol. Allowed values are:
* AES * DES
The SNMPv3 Community User Name.

SAN Manager type to add. Accepted values are:
* bna or Brocade Network Advisor * HP (HPN 5900CP or HPN 5900AF) * Cisco
Use to enable SSL communication with the SAN Manager (specifically for the BNA SAN Manager type.)
Username used to authenticate and manage the SAN Manager. This is only applicable for BNA SAN Manager.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
Async task.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $task = Add-HPOVSanManager -type BNA -hostname BNA.contoso.com -username Administrator -password password -usessl PS C:\> Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task

dev:remarks.dev:para: Add a new Brocade Network Advisor SAN Manager.

maml:description.maml:para: Import a supported Storage System

This Cmdlet will assist with importing a supported Storage System. In order for the Storage Ports to be mapped to Expected Networks, either a Supported SAN Manager will need to be configured, or 3PAR Direct Attach networks will have to exist.
When adding supported HP 3PAR storage systems, please make sure "startwsapi" has been executed from the HP 3PAR CLI, which enables the HP 3PAR REST API that is required by HPE OneView.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
Specify the HP 3PAR Virtual Domain name. Default is 'NO DOMAIN'. The value provided is CAsesEnSItive.
IP Address of FQDN of the storage systems.
Password of administrator account password.

Specify the Host Ports and Expected Network in an Array of PSCustomObject entries.
Example: @{"1:1:1"="Fabric A";"2:2:2"="Fabric B"}
Administrator account of the target storage system.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Add Storage System Async Task.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $task = Add-HPOVStorageSystem -hostname "3par-array.consoto.com" -username 3paradm -password 3pardata PS C:\> Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task

dev:remarks.dev:para: Add the Storage System using default settings, and let the appliance detect the connected Storage System Ports. (A supported SAN Manager must first be added, and Managed SANs mapped to the specific FC Network resources.)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------

dev:remarks.dev:para: Add the Storage System using default settings, and specify the Storage System Ports that will be assigned to the Expected Networks.

maml:description.maml:para: Import an existing Storage Volume resource.

This Cmdlet will help add an existing storage volume that was provisioned on the Storage System. The volume should not be exported or assigned to a server or groups of servers. The Storage Volume also must reside in the Managed Domain of the Stroage System that the appliance managed. The Storage Volume's WWN will be needed.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
Provide a description for the volume.
Include this switch to mark the Storage Volume as a Shareable resource for shared volume access. Default: Private
The Storage Systems' Device Name of the volume. This can be found in either the 3PAR IMC, CLI or HPE SSMC by looking at the provisionined volume and copying the 'Name' property.
The Storage System where the volume will be imported from. Volume to be imported must be provisioned to the same Managed Domain as the Storage System.
Aliases [-volid, -id, -wwn] The 128bit WWN FC address of the volume to be imported. Address must be in the following format: AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:AA
Aliases [-name] Specify the Storage Volume Name.
Storage Pool Name or URI
Storage Pool resource object
Async create task

dev:remarks.dev:para: Import the volume '50:00:2A:C0:03:1E:15:2C' from the '3ParSys1' Storage System.
Import the volume '50:00:2A:C0:03:1E:15:2C' from the '3ParSys1' Storage System.

maml:description.maml:para: [DEPRECATED] Clear an Alert status.
DEPRECATED as of 2.0. Please use Set-HPOVAlert
Initiate a connection to an HPE OneView appliance.

Establish a connection with the specified HPE OneView appliance. Logs the user into the appliance and establishes a session for use with subsequent requests. Prompts will be displayed for any omitted values.
Appliance hostname or IP can include an alternate TCP port number. While the appliance does not allow the default TCP port 443 to be changed, the appliance could reside behind a firewall, which is redirecting an alternate TCP port number.

Aliases [-AuthProvider]
The Directory Name for LDAP/Active Directory authentication, or LOCAL for appliance internal user accounts.
Default is determined by examinig registry at HKCU\Software\Hewlett-Packard\HPOneView, and if a valid REG_SZ property of 'AuthProvider#{Hostname' exists This REG property is configured when Set-HPOVLDAPDefaultDirectory is used. Otherwise, 'LOCAL'.

Aliases [-appliance]
The hostname or IP address of the appliance. When attempting to use an IPv6 Address, it must be encapsulated with the left backet '[' and the right backet ']'. Example: [fde4:8dba:82e1::1]

When a Login Message has been configured and acknowledgement is Required, use this parameter to acknowledge it during the initial call. Otherwise, if omitted, and a Login Banner acknowledgement is required, the caller will be prompted. This prompt does not support the -Confirm parameter.

Aliases [-p]
Password to log into the appliance.

Aliases [-u, -user]
User name to authenticate.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: On error, appliance response is returned.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Connect-HPOVMgmt -appliance myappliance.domain.com -UserName Administrator -Password MyPassword
ConnectionID Name UserName AuthLoginDomain Default Connection ------------ ---- -------- --------------- ------------------ 1 myappliance.domain.com Administrator LOCAL True

dev:remarks.dev:para: Connect to a specific appliance FQDN.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Connect-HPOVMgmt -Hostname myappliance.domain.com:11223 -Username Administrator -Password MyPassword

dev:remarks.dev:para: Connect to a specific appliance, where the target TCP port isn't the default.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $MyPassword = Read-Host 'Password' -AsSecureString -Force PS C:\> Connect-HPOVMgmt -Hostname myappliance.domain.com -Username Administrator -Password $MyPassword
ConnectionID Name UserName AuthLoginDomain ------------ ---- -------- --------------- 1 myappliance.domain.com Administrator LOCAL

dev:remarks.dev:para: Connect to a specific appliance FQDN, providing a SecureString object for the -Password parameter.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Connect-HPOVMgmt -Hostname [fde4:8dba:82e1::1] -Username Administrator -Password MyPassword
ConnectionID Name UserName AuthLoginDomain Default Connection ------------ ---- -------- --------------- ------------------ 1 [fde4:8dba:82e1::1] Administrator LOCAL True

dev:remarks.dev:para: Connect to a specific appliance, using it's IPv6 Address (DHCPv6 or Static).

maml:description.maml:para: Create a Server Profile Template from Server Profile.

This Cmdlet will allow the user to 'clone' or create a Server Profile Template from an existing Server Profile object. Not all Server Profile features will be converted to a Server Profile Template. For instance, the following features are not supported with a Server Profile Template:
* Import existing local Smart Array Logical Disk configuration * Attach SAN Storage Volumes must be assigned a unique LUN ID
If the source Server Profile has the 'Import existing logical drives' enabled, this setting will be disabled, and the Local Disk Configuration policy will be set to 'disabled'.
If any SAN Storage Volume attachments contain an 'Auto' LUN value, it will be set to 'Manual', with the LUN ID set to a unique value based on the Array Index value.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default
Use this switch to recieve the async task back for the caller to monitor and not wait for the task to complete.
The Server Profile Template Name to assign. If omitted, then a new name of 'Copy of - {Original_Name}' will be defined.

Aliases [-source, -name]
A source Server Profile Object or Resource Name.
A Server Profile resource object from Get-HPOVServerProfile.
Multiple HPOneView.ServerProfile [System.Management.Automation.PSCustomObject] objects.
Asynchronous task of the Server Profile Template creation request.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVServerProfile MyProfile | ConvertTo-HPOVServerProfileTemplate -Name 'Hypervisor Gold Template 1'

dev:remarks.dev:para: Use Get-HPOVServerProfile to retrieve the 'MyProfile' object, and pipe it to ConvertTo-HPOVServerProfileTemplate, creating a new Server Profile Template 'Hyervisor Gold Template 1'.

maml:description.maml:para: COnvert an existing Storage Volume Snapshot to a Storage Volume.
Storage Volume Snapshots can be converted to assignable and managed Storage Volume resources. When converting a Snapshot to a Storag Volume, it will lose its parent/child relationship.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
The description of the storage volume.
The Storage Volume Name.
Specify if the new storage volume should be Private or Shared.
Provide the snapshot resource object to convert managed by the appliance.
Storage Volume Snapshot resource object.
Multiple resources
Create Storage Volume async task.

dev:remarks.dev:para: Return all storage volume resource objects.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Snapshots = Get-HPOVStorageVolume 'Volume 1' | Get-HPOVStorageVolumeSnapshot PS C:\> $Snapshots | ? { ((Get-Date $_.created -Format d) -eq (Get-Date 02/23/2016 -format d)} | ConvertTo-HPOVStorageVolume -Name 'Copy of Volume 1' | Wait-HPOVTaskComplete

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get all of the available storage volume snapshots for 'Volume 1', then convert the snapshot created on the specified date to a storage volume resource.

maml:description.maml:para: Enable remote syslog.

The remoteSyslog API provides the ability to configure remote logging on devices managed by OneView. This Cmdlet handles enabling the remote syslog configuration. Only a single destination can be set. When configured, the HPE OneView appliance will deploy the SysLog settings to managed resources automatically.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Address Pool information.

This Cmdlet will get the avilable and configured Address Pools, and their associated Ranges from the appliance. Currently, the appliance supports the following Address Pools:
* VMAC * VWWN * VSN
You can specify one, some or all of the Pool types. A Range switch is provided to include the associated Range objects. A report switch is provided to display a report of each Address Pool type.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default
Include the associated Ranges within the response.
Generate a report view of all or specified Pools. Can include the ranges within the pool.
The Address Pool type. Accepted values are VMAC, VWWN, VSN, or All.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
Single Address Pool and its contents.
Collection of Address Pools and their contents.

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get the address pools.
Get the address pools, and associated ranges.
Get the vmac address pool, and associated ranges.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Address Pool Range information.
This Cmdlet will display a specific Address Pool Range.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Specify the type of Address Range Pool, or the Address Pool object fro Get-HPOVAddressPool. Allowed values are:
* VMAC * VWWN * VSN * All
Default: All
Address Pool object piped from Get-HPOVAddresPool.
Single Address Pool Range object.
Collection of Address Pool Range(s).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVAddressPoolRange -range VMAC Name Enabled Category Total Allocated Available Reserved Start End ---- ------- -------- ----- --------- --------- -------- ----- --- VMAC True GENERATED 1048576 0 1048576 0 8A:AD:88:90:00:00 8A:AD:88:9F:FF:FF

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get the address pool ranges from the 'VMAC' pool.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: [PS] C:\> Get-HPOVAddressPool | Get-HPOVAddressPoolRange Name Enabled Category Total Allocated Available Reserved Start End ---- ------- -------- ----- --------- --------- -------- ----- --- VMAC True Generated 1048576 2 1048574 0 62:79:84:50:00:00 62:79:84:5F:FF:FF VWWN True Generated 1048576 0 1048576 0 10:00:92:5a:1f:b0:00:00 10:00:92:5a:1f:bf:ff:ff VSN True Generated 46656 1 46655 0 VCGBWAB000 VCGBWABZZZ VMAC True Generated 1048576 0 1048576 0 F6:38:E6:90:00:00 F6:38:E6:9F:FF:FF VWWN True Generated 1048576 0 1048576 0 10:00:ce:58:fa:50:00:00 10:00:ce:58:fa:5f:ff:ff VSN True Generated 46656 0 46656 0 VCGA290000 VCGA290ZZZ

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get all configured Address Pool Ranges from all connected appliances.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: [PS] C:\Users\clynch> Get-HPOVAddressPoolRange vmac Name Enabled Category Total Allocated Available Reserved Start End ---- ------- -------- ----- --------- --------- -------- ----- --- VMAC True Generated 1048576 2 1048574 0 62:79:84:50:00:00 62:79:84:5F:FF:FF VMAC True Generated 1048576 0 1048576 0 F6:38:E6:90:00:00 F6:38:E6:9F:FF:FF

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get a specific Address Pool Range type (VMAC) from all connected appliances.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: [PS] C:\Users\clynch> Get-HPOVAddressPool -ApplianceConnection $con1 | Get-HPOVAddressPoolRange Name Enabled Category Total Allocated Available Reserved Start End ---- ------- -------- ----- --------- --------- -------- ----- --- VMAC True Generated 1048576 2 1048574 0 62:79:84:50:00:00 62:79:84:5F:FF:FF VWWN True Generated 1048576 0 1048576 0 10:00:92:5a:1f:b0:00:00 10:00:92:5a:1f:bf:ff:ff VSN True Generated 46656 1 46655 0 VCGBWAB000 VCGBWABZZZ

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get all configured Address Pools form Get-HPOVAddressPool and a specific appliance, and display the configured ranges.

maml:description.maml:para: List alerts logged.
Obtain all the alerts for the specified resource and/or with the specified severity.
Alerts with given alert state will be returned. State values include Active and Cleared

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default
Alerts assigned to the given user will be returned.

Alerts with given health category will be returned. Allowed health category values are:
* Appliance * DeviceBay * Enclosure * Fan * Firmware * Host * Instance * InterconnectBay * LogicalSwitch * Logs * ManagementProcessor * Memory * Network * Operational * Power * Processor * RemoteSupport * Storage * Thermal * Unknown
Alerts for the specified resource will be returned.

Alerts with given severity will be returned. Allowed severity values are:
* Unknown * Ok * Disabled * Warning * Critical
Resource URI.
Resource object (i.e. Get-HPOVServer).
Singel HPE OneView Alert.
Collection of HPE OneView Alerts.

dev:remarks.dev:para: Return all the critical alerts.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVServer 'Encl1, Bay 2' | Get-HPOVAlert -severity CRITICAL

dev:remarks.dev:para: Return all the critical alerts for server 'Encl1, Bay 2'.
Return all the alerts for server profile 'Profile 1'.
Get all alerts for 'Encl1, interconnect 2' interconnect module.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVInterconnect "Encl1, interconnect 2" | Get-HPOVAlert -severity Critical

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get 'critical' severity alerts for 'Encl1, interconnect 2' interconnect module.

Get Appliance Date/Time Configuration.

This CMDLET displays the appliance or connected appliancces Date and Time configuration. Part of this is the actual Date and Time of the appliance, Time Zone, NTP Servers, NTP polling, and Locale.
When queriying a Virtual Machine Appliance and the NTPServers property or field is Null, the appliance will retrieve its Date and Time from the Hypervisor Host.
When queriying a Synergy Composer appliance and the NTPServers property or field is Null, the appliance will retrieve its Date and Time from the System ROM.

PS C:\> Get-HPOVLicense Product : HP OneView Advanced AvailableCapacity : 1 ConsumedCapacity : 0 TotalCapacity : 1 UnlicensedCount : 0
Product : HP OneView Advanced AvailableCapacity : 1 ConsumedCapacity : 0 TotalCapacity : 1 UnlicensedCount : 0
Product : HP OneView Advanced AvailableCapacity : 16 ConsumedCapacity : 16 TotalCapacity : 32 UnlicensedCount : 0
Product : HP OneView Advanced w/o iLO AvailableCapacity : 9 ConsumedCapacity : 7 TotalCapacity : 16 UnlicensedCount : 0

dev:remarks.dev:para: Retrieve all installed license objects on the connected appliance(s).

PS C:\> Get-HPOVLicense -report License Name Available Total Associated Nodes ------------ --------- ----- ---------------- HPE OneView Advanced 242 256 14
Device License Type Applied Date ------ ------------ ------------ Encl1, bay 1 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 11 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 12 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 13 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 14 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 15 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 16 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 2 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 3 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 4 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 5 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 6 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 7 Permanent 12/8/2014 Encl1, bay 8 Permanent 12/8/2014

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Logical Enclosure resource(s).
Obtain a collection of Logical Enclosure resources, or a single Logical Enclosure with the specified name.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
The name of the Logical Enclosure resource to be returned. All Logical Enclosure resources will be returned if omitted.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
Single Enclosure Group

Multiple Enclosure Groups
The matching enclosure group resources.

dev:remarks.dev:para: Return all the Logical Enclosure resources managed by all appliances.
Return all found Logical Enclosure resources on MyAppliance.domain.com appliance.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Logical Interconnect resource(s).
Retrieves a list of all Logical Interconnect or just specific ones via a query if the name parameter is provided. The output can be sent to a file using the exportFile parameter.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default
Aliases [-x, -export] The full path and file name to export the contents retrieved from the call to Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect.
The name of the Logical Interconnect to retrieve.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
Single Logical Interconnect
Multiple Logical Interconnects

dev:type.maml:name: A Logical Interconnect or collection of Logical Interconnects

maml:description.maml:para: A Logical Interconnect or collection of Logical Interconnects

dev:remarks.dev:para: Returns all Logical Interconnect defined on the appliance to standard output.
Returns just the Production Logical Interconnect object to standard output.
Returns the Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect query and stores it in the object $myLogicalICs
Returns the Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect query results to the file c:\myApplianceConfig\LogicaICs.json

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Logical Interconnect Group resource(s).
Retrieves a list of all Logical Interconnect Groups or just specific ones via a query if the name parameter is provided. The output can be sent to a file using the exportFile parameter.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default
The name of the Logical Interconnect Group to retrieve.
Pipeline input resource generated from Wait-HPOVTaskComplete, or successfully completed Async Task resource object.
Aliases [-x, -export] The full path and file name to export the contents retrieved from the call to Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup.
Successfully Completed Async task resource from Wait-HPOVTaskComplete or other supported method.
A Logical Interconnect Group resource.
A collection of Logical Interconnect Group resources.

dev:remarks.dev:para: Returns all Logical Interconnect Groups defined on the appliance to standard output.
Returns just the Production Logical Interconnect Group object to standard output.
Returns the Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup query and stores it in the object $myLigs

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $LigName = 'VC FF Virt Prod' PS C:\> $CreatedLig = New-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup -Name $LigName -bays @{1 = "FlexFabric";2 = "FlexFabric"} -EnableIgmpSnooping $True -InternalNetworks 'VMMigration Network' | Wait-HPOVTaskComplete | Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup PS C:\> $CreatedLig
Name Enclosure Groups ---- ---------------- VC FF Virt Prod

dev:remarks.dev:para: Create a new Logical Interconnect Group resource, wait for the task to complete, then retrieve the created resource.
Returns the Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup query results to the file c:\myApplianceConfig\LogicaICGs.json

maml:description.maml:para: Get appliancce Login Message.
Retreive the current Login Message for the connected appliance(s).

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
If successful, returns a resource.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-HPOVLoginMessage Appliance : hpov1.domain.com Message : ************************************ ***** WARNING ******** ************************************ This management appliance is a company owned asset and provided for the exclusive use of authorized personnel. Unauthorized use or abuse of this system may lead to corrective action including termination, civil and/or criminal penalties. Acknowledge : True
Appliance : hpov2.domain.com Message : ************************************ ***** WARNING ******** ************************************ This management appliance is a company owned asset and provided for the exclusive use of authorized personnel. Unauthorized use or abuse of this system may lead to corrective action including termination, civil and/or criminal penalties. Acknowledge : False

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get the Login Message from all connected appliances.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Managed SAN resource(s).
This Cmdlet is used to display or list the available Managed SAN resources in the appliance.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
Managed SAN Name to retrieve.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
Single Resource
Multiple Resources

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVManagedSan Name State Status Network Zoned Automated Zoning ---- ----- ------ ------- ----- ---------------- Fabric A Ready OK BNA Managed Fabric A Zoned True

dev:remarks.dev:para: Fabric B Ready OK BNA Managed Fabric B Zoned True

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVManagedSan "Fabric A" Name State Status Network Zoned Automated Zoning ---- ----- ------ ------- ----- ---------------- Fabric A Ready OK BNA Managed Fabric A Zoned True

dev:remarks.dev:para: Show the 'Fabric A' Managed SAN resource object.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Network resource(s).
Obtain a collection of network resources which have the specified type and/or name. The default connection information is included in the returned network resources.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default
The name of the network resource to be returned. All network resources will be returned if omitted. Supports '*' wildcard character.

The type of the network resource to be returned. Valid types are "Ethernet" for Ethernet networks, "FC" or "FibreChannel" for Fibre Channel networks. All network resources will be returned if omitted.

Aliases [-x, -export] The full path and file name to export the JSON formatted definition of the networks to a file. The directory for the file is validated prior to execution and the function returns an error is the directory does not exist.
Network Resource Name(s).
Single Ethernet Network resource.
Single Fibre Channel Network resource.
Single FCoE Network resource.
Multiple Network Object resources

dev:remarks.dev:para: Return the network resource with the name "Net-41"
Return all the Ethernet network resources
Return all Ethernet Networks that match 'VLAN_19*'.
Return Net1, Net2, and Net3 Ethernet Networks from the specified appliance connection.
Exports all networks to the file myNets.json in JSON format.
Exports only the ethernet networks to the file myNets.json.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Power Device (mPDU/Rack PDU) Potentail Connections

Obtain a collection of potential managed and unmanaged device power connections for the provided power device resoruce. The returned value(s) will include the potential power connections that can be manually associated when not using iPDU devices.

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Potential managed/unmanaged device Power Delivery Device connection object.
Collection of matching potential power device connection objects.

dev:remarks.dev:para: Return the potential power device connections for the "iPDU_A" power delivery device.
Return the potential power device connections for the "iPDU_A" power delivery device.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the configured remote syslog settings.
The remoteSyslog API provides the ability to configure remote logging on devices managed by OneView. This Cmdlet handles retrieving the remote syslog configuration.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
If successful, returns Appliance Syslog settings.
Collection of Appliance Syslog settings.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVRemoteSyslog Appliance Destination Port Enabled --------- ----------- ---- ------- appliance1.domain.com False appliance2.domain.com 10.150.20.1 514 True

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get the current configuration from all connected appliances.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVRemoteSyslog -ApplianceConnection appliance1.domain.com Appliance Destination Port Enabled --------- ----------- ---- ------- appliance1.domain.com False

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get the current configuration from specified connected appliance.

maml:description.maml:para: Get State Change Message Bus certificates.
Retrieve and store the certificates necessary to register with the State Change Message Bus. The SCMB only supports a single read-only "account".

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
Aliases [-pfx] Convert rabbitmq_readonly client certificate to PFX format for .Net consumption.
Aliases [-Save] Directory to store the SSL certificates. If the directory doesn't exist, it will be created.
Password that will be used to encrypt the PFX client certificate.
Password for PFX file

* {ApplianceConnection_Name}_ca.cer - Appliance internal Root Certificate Authority * {ApplianceConnection_Name}_cert.cer - Appliance managed rabbitmq_readonly user Public Key * {ApplianceConnection_Name}_privateKey.key - Appliance managed rabbitmq_readonly user Client Certificate

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get the HPE OneView appliance SCMB SSL certificates, and save them in the current directory.
Prompt for secure password input and pipe the value to Get-HPOVScmbCertificates to convert the cert.pem to PFX format with the pipeline secure password.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Server Hardware resource(s).

Obtain a collection of server hardware resources, a specific server with the specified name, or server hardware resources without an assigned Server Profile. Returned resources will display:
* Device Name * Serial Number * Model * System ROM * iLO and its firmware * Server Profile * Status * Licensing

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
The name of the server hardware resource to be returned. All server hardware resources will be returned if omitted. Supports * wildcard character.
Optional parameter that can be used with the report parameter to display Servers without a Server Profile assigned.
Provide the Server Hardware Type Name or Object to filter for available server hardware.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Single Server Hardware resource.
Multiple Server Hardware resources.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Server Hardware Type resource(s).

Obtain a collection of server hardware types. This includes information about the type of server, adapter layout and features, and possible server BIOS settings. This Cmdlet is also used with the New-HPOVServerProfile Cmdlet to retrieve the list of BIOS settings and adapters to configure.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
The name of the server hardware type resource to be returned. All server hardware type resources will be returned if omitted.

Aliases [-x, -export]
The path where the resource will be exported to, in JSON text format.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
Single Server Hardware type
Multiple Server Hardware types.

dev:remarks.dev:para: Return all the server hardware types on the appliance.
Return the "BL460 Gen8 1" server hardware type on the appliance.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve Server Profile resource(s).

This Cmdlet will obtain a collection of Server Profile resources, or a specific Server Profile the specified name. It returns all aspects of the Server Profile.
This will also provide the ability to export Server Profile objects to their own JSON encoded file. All appliance unique properties (minus the Server Hardware Type, Enclosure Group, and Connection Network assignment) are removed. Connection layout, assigned addresses, networks, bandwidth, BIOS, Boot Order, Firmware settings will all be retained. Assigned Address types will change from Virtual to UserDefined in order to retain their assignment.

maml:description.maml:para: Configure appliance SMTP Reporting settings.

This Cmdlet configures the SMTP settings for the appliance. SMTP settings include deining the Sender EMAIL Address, SMTP relay server address, SMTP relay server TCP port, optional password, and if SMTP alerting is enabled or disabled.
Currently, HPE OneView does not support Secure SMTP, even though the TCP Port can be modified. Using the SmtpPort parameter is to specify an alternate TCP Port than the default TCP/25.

maml:description.maml:para: Import an appliance SSL Certificate.

By default, the HPE OneView appliance creates a self-signed SSL Certificate for its WebUI. There might be a desire to trust the certificate, in case the SHA-1 hash becomes invalid (either due to a certificate change or man-in-the-middle attack) and the caller would like to be notified. This Cmdlet will assist in retrieving and storing the appliance self-generated SSL Certificate into the current users Trusted Root Certification Authorities store.
Please note that the Subject Alternate Name (SAN) must match that of the Appliance hostname you use to connect to your appliance. If it does not, an SSL conenction failure will ocurr. When creating a CSR on the appliance, make sure to include the additional FQDN and IP address(es) in the Alternative Name field.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
None.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Connection = Connect-HPOVMgmt Myappliance.domain.com Administrator MyP@ssword PS C:\> Import-HPOVSslCertificate -ApplianceConnection $Connection

dev:remarks.dev:para: Import the SSL certificate from the specific appliance.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Connect-HPOVMgmt Myappliance.domain.com Administrator MyP@ssword PS C:\> Connect-HPOVMgmt Myappliance2.domain.com Administrator MyP@ssword PS C:\> Import-HPOVSslCertificate

dev:remarks.dev:para: Import the SSL Certificate from all connected sessions.

Async task resource object to monitor committing certificate, and deploying HP SIM SSO certificate update to managed/monitored devices.
#.EXAMPLE PS C:\> $Task = gc C:\dir\hpov.cer | Install-HPOVApplianceCertificate | Wait-HPOVTaskComplete
Read the signed SSL certificate private key and install it on the appliance, and wait for the task to complete.
#.EXAMPLE PS C:\> $cert = GC C:\dir\hpov.cer PS C:\> Install-HPOVApplianceCertificate $Cert | Wait-HPOVTaskComplete
Read the signed SSL certificate private key and install it on the appliance, and wait for the task to complete.
Install Logical Interconnect Firmware.

Use this Cmdlet to install/update the Logical Interconnect (i.e. Virtual Connect) firmware. You can provide the Logical Interconnect Name, URI or Object and must specify a valid SPP Baseline present on the appliance.
This Cmdlet will default to performing an Update (Stage + Activate), which will cause an outage. If you wish to avoid an outage, first stage the update usind -method stage, then -method activate. Interconnect activation can be controlled with the -ActivateOrder parameter, which defaults to Odd interconnects. Once the specified interconnect activation is complete, you must then call the Cmdlet again with the alternate ActivateOrder value (i.e. even.)

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value.
Do not wait for the task to complete, and return the task resource object immediately for the caller to then monitor.
Firmware Baseline Name, URI or Object.

The amount of time in seconds to delay activating additional modules.
Default is 5 seconds.

Aliases [-order, -ActivateOrder] Specify the Ethernet module firmware activation order. Accepted values are:
* OddEven (Default) * Parallel * Serial

The amount of time in seconds to delay activating additional modules.
Default is 5 seconds.

Specify the Fibre Channel module firmware activation order. Accepted values are:
* OddEven * Parallel * Serial (Default)
Force the firmware update if the update version matches what is already installed.
Aliases [-li, -uri, -name] The Logical Interconnect object(s), name(s) or uris(s) to be updated.

Upgrade method to perform. Accepted values are:
* UPDATE (Default) * STAGE * ACTIVATE
Logical Inteconnect URI or Name
An Array of Logical Interconnect resource URI's, Names or Objects.
Logical Interconnect Resource Object
Async task

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $li = Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect Encl1-LI PS C:\> $spp = Get-HPOVSppFile "HP Service Pack for ProLiant" PS C:\> $task = Install-HPOVLogicalInterconnectFirmware Stage $li $spp PS C:\> Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task PS C:\> $task = Install-HPOVLogicalInterconnectFirmware Activate $li PS C:\> Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task

dev:remarks.dev:para: Perform a firmware update of the Encl1-LI Logical Interconnect by first staging the firmware. Then Acitate the firmware using the default OddEven Interconnect Bay order.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect Encl1-LI | Install-HPOVLogicalInterconnectFirmware -method Update -baseline "HP Service Pack for ProLiant" -confirm:$false | Wait-HPOVTaskComplete

dev:remarks.dev:para: Perform a firmware update of the Encl1-LI Logical Interconnect, do not prompt for confirmation, then wait for the task to complete.

maml:description.maml:para: Install or stage an appliance update.
The Install-HPOVUpdate installs an appliance update package to upgrade the platform to the specified version. Use the -Stage switch to stage an update on the appliance.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
Display Release Notes of Update
Will display EULA if no value is provided. Pass 'accept' to accept and not display EULA.
Aliases [-f] Appliance Update file to install.
Install pending update that was previously staged.
Aliases [-list] List any pending updates on the appliance that might have been staged.
Used to upload update to appliance and not apply update.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
Will display a progress bar indicating the Appliance Update status.
When performing stage and install (no switch options provided), the return will include the uploaded patch information from the appliance, and the completed upgrade message.

dev:remarks.dev:para: Install the Update.bin package to the appliance. User will be prompted to accept the upgrade EULA, and if a reboot is required also be prompted to confirm.
Stage the update on the appliance, and display the Release Notes to the PowerShell console.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Install-HPOVUpdate -file C:\Path\update.bin -Stage PS C:\> Install-HPOVUpdate -EULA Accept -InstallNow

dev:remarks.dev:para: Stage the Update.bin package to the appliance. After update has been staged, install the update now on specified appliance.
List a pending, staged updates on the appliance, then display the Release Notes to the PowerShell console.

maml:description.maml:para: Migrate Virtual Connect Manager to HP OneView.

This function is used to migrate an existing Virtual Connect Manager configuration to HP OneView. If an enclosure was added to an HP OneView appliance as Monitor-Only, then you must first remove the enclosure from the appliance, and then use this Cmdlet to migrate the enclosure.
Using the -VCEMCMS, -VCEMUser and -VCEMPassword parameters, the targeted Virtual Connect Domain can be removed from a Virual Connect Enterprise Manager Domain Group first before initiating the VC Migration tool within the HP OneView appliance.
The required VCEM 7.3/7.4 Patch is available here: ftp://ftp.hp.com/pub/softlib2/software1/pubsw-generic/p270829882/v106568.
VCEM 7.4.1 or greater users do not require the patch to be installed, as the API is built into 7.4.1 or greater.
It is important to also have a Virtual Connect Domain Backup prior to migration. You may also want to gather the output from the 'show config -includepoolinfo' VCM CLI command to review or verify resources were migrated successfully.
Please read 'Chapter 9 Planning for enclosure migration from VCM into HP OneView' in the HP OneView 1.20 User Guide for more information about migration and other planning resources.
Aliases [-appliance] The name of the appliance or list of appliances to execute the command against.
Aliases [-NoWait] OPTIONAL. Do not wait on the migration task to complete. If omitted, the Cmdlet will monitor the task to completion before returning control to the caller.

Aliases [-eg] OPTIONAL. The Name, URI or Object of an existing Enclosure Group. If the Enclosure Group Name does not exist, a new resource with the String value provided will be created. If omitted, a new Enclosure Group will be created based on the Serial Number of the Enclosure (Example: 'EG_USE1234567A').

REQUIRED if the -report switch is provided. The directory path in which to save the report output to a file.
* Filename will be created in the format: [path]\{enclsoureName}_{date}.report

Aliases [-lig] OPTIONAL. The Name, URI or Object of an existing Logical Interconnect Group. If the Logical Interconnect Group Name does not exist, a new resource with the String value provided will be created. If omitted, a new Logical Interconnect Group will be created based on the Serial Number of the Enclosure (Example: 'LIG_USE1234567A').
Aliases [-oaip] REQUIRED. IP address or FQDN of the Primary Onboard Administrator in the target enclosure.
Aliases [-op] REQUIRED. Password for the Administrator account of the target OA.
Aliases [-ou] REQUIRED. Administrator account of the target OA.
OPTIONAL. Execute the migration report only. Do not execute the migration process.
The IP Address or FQDN of the Virtual Connect Enterprise Manager CMS host.
A Virtual Connect Enterprise Manager Administrator account password.
A Virtual Connect Enterprise Manager Administrator account name.
Aliases [-vp] REQUIRED. Password for the Administrator account of Virtual Connect Manager.
Aliases [-vu]

Aliases [-license, -l] REQUIRED. Specifies whether the intent is to apply either OneView or OneView w/o iLO licenses to the servers in the enclosure being imported.
Accepted values are
* OneView * OneViewNoiLO
Valid Enclosure Group resource the appliance will migrate the source enclosure into.
Async task Resource object for monitoring the enclosure import process.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $task = Remove-HPOVServerProfile -profile "Profile6" PS C:\> Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task.uri

dev:remarks.dev:para: Remove the profile specifed by name. Wait for remove to complete.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $profile = Get-HPOVServerProfile -name "Profile2" PS C:\> Remove-HPOVServerProfile $profile -confirm:$false

dev:remarks.dev:para: Remove the profile specifed by $profile. Disable confirmation prompt.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-HPOVServerProfile | Remove-HPOVServerProfile Search for all profiles and remove them from appliance.PS C:\> Invoke-HPOVVcmMigration -OAIPAddress 192.168.19.40 -OAUserName Administrator -OAPassword hpinvent -VCMUserName Administrator -VCMPassword hpinvent -licensingIntent OneView

dev:remarks.dev:para: Migration will occur and create a new Enclosure Group and new Logical Interconnect Group based on the enclosure serial number.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-HPOVVcmMigration -OAIPAddress 192.168.19.40 -OAUserName Administrator -OAPassword hpinvent -VCMUserName Administrator -VCMPassword hpinvent -eg "EnclosureGroup1" -licensingIntent OneView

dev:remarks.dev:para: Migration will occur and import the target enclosure into an existing Enclosure Group named "EnclosureGroup1"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-HPOVVcmMigration -OAIPAddress 192.168.19.40 -OAUserName Administrator -OAPassword hpinvent -VCMUserName Administrator -VCMPassword hpinvent -licensingIntent OneView -report -export "c:\VCM-MigrationReports" The migration report will be executed and the result saved to the file "c:\VCM-MigrationReports\{enclosureName}_{date}.report".

dev:remarks.dev:para: Migration will not be attempted.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-HPOVVcmMigration -OAIPAddress 192.168.19.40 -OAUserName Administrator -OAPassword hpinvent -VCMUserName Administrator -VCMPassword hpinvent -licensingIntent OneView -VCEMCMS vcemcms.contoso.com -VCEMUser Domain\Adminisrator -VCEMPassword MyPassword

dev:remarks.dev:para: Perform a migration of a VCEM managed enclosure to HP OneView.

maml:description.maml:para: Attach an existing server profile to a server profile template
Binds a server profile resource to the provided server profile template

maml:description.maml:para: Create an Address Range.

This Cmdlet will assist with creating a new Address Pool Range. The support Address Pool Types are MAC Addresses (VMAC), Fibre Channel/FCoE World Wide Name (VWWN), and Server Serial Number (VSN).
When creating new Address Pool Ranges, the Generated Range Type will allocate 1,048,576 MAC or WWN addresses, whereas it will allocate 46,656 Serial Numbers.
If you specify a Custom Range Type, you must specify a range of addresses no smaller than 128, and no more than 1,048,576 per range.
Custom Address Ranges must adhere to the following format rules:
* The MAC Address must be IEEE Compliant, and the format must be XH:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX, where H must be 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, A, C or E.
Example: 12:22:33:44:55:00
* The WWN Address must be IEEE compliant, and the format must be 10:00:XH:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX, where H must be 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, A, C or E.
Example: 10:00:6C:9F:06:B0:00:00
* The Serial Number addresses must start with VCU, and cannot contain more than 10 characters total.
Example: VCU1234567

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default
The ending address in the range. Cannot overlap with other address ranges.

Specify the Pool Type the new Range will be assinged to. Accepted values are:
* VMAC * VWWN * VSN

The type of Address Range to create. Accepted values are:
* Generated * Custom
The starting address in the range. Cannot overlap with other address ranges.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
Newly created and assigned Address Pool Range resource object.

dev:remarks.dev:para: Create a new Appliance generated VMAC Pool Range.
Create a new VWWN Address Pool Range with the custom addresses, for the MyAppliance1.domain.com appliance connection.

maml:description.maml:para: Generate appliance CSR
This Cmdlet will create the CSR for an given appliance, to then be submitted to a CA.

Aliases [-SAN] An optional entry containing additional names that apply to the owner of the certificate, possibly including additional e-mail addresses, DNS names, IP addresses and other identifiers.
Example: "hpov.example.com,hpov,192.168.1.1"

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
The challenge password is a required entry and must contain a minimum of 8 characters. If you wish to be prompted to supply the password, use an asterisk (*) character.
Aliases [-L, -Locality] The city or locality is a required entry, can contain up to 128 characters.

Aliases [-CN] The common name is a required entry, and can be FQDN/hostname or IPv4/IPv6 address.
Example: "hpov.example.com"
Aliases [-Contact] The name of the contact person, may not exceed 64 characters.
Aliases [-C] The country code is a required entry and must contain only two letters.
The distinguished name qualifier, which further identifies the certificate recipient, which may not exceed 128 characters.
The contact person's email address, which may not exceed 128 characters and is of the format name@domain.
Aliases [-Giv] The contact person's first name, which may not exceed 64 characters.
The contact person's initials, which may not exceed 20 characters.
Aliases [-O] The organization name is a required entry, can contain up to 64 characters.
Aliases [-OU] The entry for the organizational unit name, may not exceed 64 characters.
Aliases [-ST, -Province] The state or province is a required entry, can contain up to 128 characters.
Aliases [-Sur] The contact person's family name, which may not exceed 64 characters.
Aliases [-UN] Defined by the certificate authority, and may contain up to 64 characters. Consult the certificate authority's administrator or documentation for more information.

dev:type.maml:name: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
Object that contains the base64data property, which can then be written to a file or submitted to CA.

maml:description.maml:para: Generate and download appliance backup.

Use this Cmdlet to generate and download an appliance configuration backup file for backup purposes. The backup file does not contain user account passwords. The backup file is not meant to restore to other appliance for quick provisioning, as it is an encrypted TAR GZIP file.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default

Aliases [-save]
The full path to where the Support Dump will be saved to. The downloaded file name will be generated by the appliance. If the directory does not exist, it will be created. By default will use current directory.

maml:description.maml:para: None. You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.
The generated backup File

dev:remarks.dev:para: This command will save the Appliance backup file to C:\Temp

maml:description.maml:para: Create Custom Baseline from Hotfixes and Source Baseline.

HPE ProLiant Hotfixes are released out of the main SPP release cycle. Administrators can use HPSUM external to HPE OneView to create a custom baseline, but then need to upload to the appliance. Hotfixes can be directly uploaded to an HPE OneView 2.0 Appliance, with the ability to create a Custom Baseline by using a source Baseline (which must exist in the Baseline Repository) and specified Hotfix(s).

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default

The final custom Baseline name.
Example: custom_SPPGen9Snap3_2015_0327_82

Array of Hotfix filenames, or Component name.
Example: @(cp111111.exe,cp222222.scexe,cp333333.exe,cp444444.scexe)
An existing Baseline within the HPE OneView Baseline Repository.
Source HPE OneView Baseline from Get-HPOVBaseline
The progress of in-progress or completion result.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> cp111111.exe,cp222222.scexe,cp333333.exe,cp444444.scexe | % { Add-HPOVBaseline $_ } PS C:\> Get-HPOVBaseline -BaselineName 'MyBaseline' | New-HPOVCustomBaseline -Hotfixes cp111111.exe,cp222222.scexe,cp333333.exe,cp444444.scexe -BaselineName 'MyNewBaseline_20160222'

dev:remarks.dev:para: Upload hotfixes to appliance, then create a new custom baseline from the 'MyBaseline' baseline.

maml:description.maml:para: Create an Enclosure Group.
Create a new Enclosure Group. An existing Logical Interconnect Group must be created prior to creating an Enclosure Group.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default
An Onboard Administrator CLI Script.

Use this parameter for the appliance to create an Enclosure Group and associated Logical Interconnect Group by 'discovering' the Enclosure and support interconnects. The target Enclosure must not already be claimed by another external manager (i.e. HPE OneView), as the API will reject the request.
No Uplink Sets will be created. They will need to be added using the New-HPOVUplinkSet Cmdlet once the Logical Interconnect Group resource has been created.
Provide the full path and file name of the JSON file.
If specified, the Logical Interconnect Group that is created will be used in the '{LigPrefix} Logical Interconnect Group'.

Aliases [-logicalInterconnectGroupUri, -logicalInterConnectGroup]
An Enclosure Group can reference multiple Logical Interconnect Groups, once per Interconnect Bay. If a Single Logical Interconnect Group object is provided (either via parameter variable or via Pipeline), the Logical Interconnect Group objects Logical Interconnect Bay configuration will be used.
To specify a specific Logical Interconnect Group(s) for one or more Interconnect Bays, use a Hashtable, with the Bay ID as the Key, and Logical Interconnect Group Name, URI or Object as the Value. Example:
PS C:\> $LogicalInterConnectGroupMapping = @{ 1 = "MyLIg1"; 2 = "MyLig1"; 5 = "OtherLIG"; 6 = "OtherLIG"}
PS C:\> $MyLig1 = Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup MyLig1 PS C:\> $OtherLIG = Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup OtherLIG PS C:\> $LogicalInterConnectGroupMapping = @{ 1 = $MyLig1; 2 = $MyLig1; 5 = $OtherLIG; 6 = $OtherLIG"
Omit this parameter to create an Enclosure Group without a Logical Interconnect Group (necessary for non-HPE Virtual Connect or HPE B22 Fabric Extender environments.
A name for the new enclosure group.
Provide the Onboard Administrator IP Address or FQDN.
Provide an Onboard Administrator administrator password.

The Power Redundancy Mode to set when an Enclosure is added to the appliance.
Allowed Values:
* RedundantPowerFeed - Provides N+N Power Redundancy Configuration * RedundantPowerSupply - Provided N+1 Power Redundancy Configuration
Provide an Onboard Administrator administrator account.
Single Logical Interconnect Group resource object.
The newly created enclosure group resource

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $mylig = Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup -name "myLogicalInterconnectGroup" PS C:\> New-HPOVEnclosureGroup -name "MyGroup" -logicalInterConnectGroup $mylig

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get the "myLogicalInterconnectGroup" object and pass it to create the "MyGroup" Enclosure Group.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Prodlig = Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup -name "Production LIG" PS C:\> $DMZlig = Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnectGroup -name "DMZ LIG" PS C:\> $ConfigurationScript = '#Configure Insight Remote Support CentralConnect >> ENABLE REMOTE_SUPPORT IRS 80.80.1.14 7906' PS C:\> New-HPOVEnclosureGroup -name "Production Enclosure Group 1" -LogicalInterconnectGroupMapping @{1 = $Prodlig; 2 = $Prodlig; 5 = $DMZlig; 6 = $DMZlig} -ConfigurationScript $ConfigurationScript

dev:remarks.dev:para: Get two different Logical Interconnect Groups, define an OA Configuration Script, then assign the LIGs to the specific Interconnect Bays for appliance 'MyAppliance1.domain.com'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-HPOVEnclosureGroup -name "MyGroup" -DiscoverFromEnclosure -OAAddress MyOAIP.domain.com -Username Administrator -Password MyPassword

dev:remarks.dev:para: Connect to the provided Onboard Administrator, detect the Interconnect Bay population to then create both a Logical Interconnect Group and associate it with the Enclosure Group being requested.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-HPOVEnclosureGroup -name "MyGroup" -DiscoverFromEnclosure -OAAddress MyOAIP.domain.com -Username Administrator -Password MyPassword -LigPrefix 'My LIG Policy'

dev:remarks.dev:para: Connect to the provided Onboard Administrator, detect the Interconnect Bay population to then create both a Logical Interconnect Group ('My LIG Policy') and associate it with the Enclosure Group being requested.

maml:description.maml:para: Add a new Directory for Authentication

This Cmdlet will create a new Directory for appliance authentication. HPE OneView currently supports either Active Directory or LDAP (e.g. OpenLDAP) for user authentication. The New-HPOVLdapServer Cmdlet is used to assist defining directory servers address, public SSL certificate and LDAP over SSL TCP port.
Using Active Directory, which sets the authProtocol to AD and userNameField to CN

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Aliases [-Root, -RootDN]
Directory Base DN (E.g. dc=domian,dc=local)
Directory name to add. Does not need to match LDAP/AD Directory Name, but should.

Aliases [-LDAP]
Using LDAP (i.e. OpenLDAP), which sets the authProtocol to LDAP and userNameField to UID
OpenLDAP OU's to begin search for Directory Group and User Account authentication. E.g. ou=admins,ou=contoso
Aliases [-p, -pass] Directory Username password in either String or SecureString format.

Array of Directory Servers and their settings. Must include the following:
* Server Name (FQDN or IP) * Public SSL Certificate * SSL Port, if not default 636
Deprecated parameter. Attribute is now controlled via either the -OpenLDAP and -AD parameter switches.
Aliases [-u, -user] Directory Username to authenticate with.
Account Password that will be used to validate the directory.
Configured Authentication Directory
Multiple configured Authentication Directories

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $ServerA,$ServerB = servera.domain.com,serverb.domain.com | New-HPOVLdapServer PS C:\> New-HPOVLdapDirectory -name Domain1 -AD -basedn 'dc=domain,dc=com' -servers $ServerA,$ServerB -Username MyAdminAccount@domain.com

dev:remarks.dev:para: Add a new directory with two directory servers, and be prompted for your directory account password.

maml:description.maml:para: Add a new Directory Group to appliance.
This Cmdlet provides the ability to add a new Directory Group to the appliance. You can use the Show-HPOVLdapGroups to retrieve a list of avialable Directory Groups from the specified Directory.

Aliases [-Appliance]
Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).
Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default
Aliases [-g, -group, -name] Directroy Group to add
Aliases [-p] Directory User account password

Aliases [-r, -role] The role(s) to assign to the Directroy Group, in System.Array format. Accepted values are:
* Read only * Infrastructure administrator * Server administrator * Storage administrator * Network administrator * Backup administrator
e.g. $roles = "Server administrator","Network administrator"
Aliases [-u] Directory Username to authenticate with
Aliases [-d, -domain, -directory] LDAP/Active Directory Domain Name
Directory User Account password
New LDAP Group object with role assignment(s).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-HPOVLdapGroup -d Domain1 -GroupName "MY Directory Group1" -roles @("Server administrator") -u 'Sarah Peterson'

dev:remarks.dev:para: Add "MY Directory Group1" from Domain1 with Server Administrator role and prompt for password for group validation.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $roles = "Server administrator","Backup administrator" PS C:\> $password = convertto-securestring -asplaintext "password123890" -force PS C:\> New-HPOVLdapGroup -d Domain1 -GroupName "MY Directory Group1" -roles $roles -u 'Sarah Peterson' -p $password

dev:remarks.dev:para: Add "MY Directory Group1" from Domain1 with Server and Backup administrator roles, and specify password for group validation.

maml:description.maml:para: Define LDAP Directory Server object.
A helper Cmdlet that will define an LDAP Directory Server object to be used with the New-HPOVLdapDirectory Cmdlet.

Aliases [-cert] Directory Server SSL Certificate, either location to Base64 Cert or multi-line string value. If omitted, the Cmdlet will attempt to retrieve the Directory Servers Secure LDAP Certiciate.
Directory server name or IP Address to add.
Aliases [-port] Directory Server's LDAP SSL Port.
Directory Server Name or IP Address
Mutlple Directory Server Name or IP Address System.String values.
New LDAP Server Resource Object to be used with New-HPOVLdap Cmdlet.
Collection of new LDAP Server Resource Object to be used with New-HPOVLdap Cmdlet.

dev:remarks.dev:para: Define a new Directory Server, ServerA, specifying the Base64 Public Certificate and using the default LDAP SSL port 636.
Define a new Directory Server, ServerA, specifying the Base64 Public Certificate, using a custom LDAP SSL port.

A text file with each license key on a new line that will be installed on the appliance.
Used for adding license keys one at a time, or if only a single license key needs to be added.
License key in String Format, from Get-Content or an Array of String.
